title: Mercury Automobiles - Mariner, Mountaineer, etc.
content:
Any idea what face is being used on the rears of recent Mercury models? Can't find great pictures online, but it's a pretty sweet sans...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mariner1_6032.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mountaineer1_5423.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mountaineer2_5089.jpg)
  

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319im_/http:/typophile.com/files/milan1_3435.jpg)

Thanks,  
--Michael.

author: mwebert

comments.content:
ummm, Michael...

you want answers AND you want _us_ to do the legwork? Dude, cut down on the hobbies and give the other folks here a little respect...

any chance [this](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/www.fountain.nu/catalogue/mercury.asp) is what you're looking for? it may seem like a tongue-in-cheek response, but it actually looks similar to my foggy memory (I don't pay much attention to Mercury automobiles these days).

Also fairly unrelated: I'm actually creating a website dedicated to auto badges and emblems which will eventually include this sort of information. In the meantime, there's [Chromeography](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/www.flickr.com/groups/chromecharacters/) for the classic stuff.

OK, OK... :-)

Added photos to the first post.

Hope that helps,  
--Michael.

------------------------------------------------------

--------------

Could it be [John Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/storm/john-sans/lite-bold/testdrive.html)?

--Michael.

------------------------------------------------------  
// love what you do or do something else. //  
Michael Ebert -- graphic designer, jazz saxophonist, horror movie devotee  
 [http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/homepage.mac.com/mwebert "http://homepage.mac.com/mwebert")  
 [mwebert@mac.com](mailto:mwebert@mac.com)  
--------------

Naw. Top stroke on John Sans 'E' has an angled end. [Freight Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=GF.118889.0.13&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=MOUNTAINER&sampleSize=47) and [Proxima Nova](http://web.archive.org/web/20130818101319/http:/www.fontshop.com/index.cfm?fuseaction=catalog.fontdetail&displayfontid=MSF.123353.0.9&attributes.sampleSize=48&sampleText=MOUNTAINER&sampleSize=46) are close. Still need better images, because all caps sans serifs are difficult.

I think you're onto something with Proxima Nova... Still looking for better pics...

--Michael.

--Michael.
